title.narrative: 5.9 PAC EMERGENCY EARTHQUAKE RESPONSE

description.narrative: PAC: Information on UNICEF response to Nepal earthquake emergency is shared widely through media statements, news notes, press meet and releases, situation reports, multimedia content and social media feeds, which contributes to Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By Dec 2017, early recovery and reconstruction efforts will enhance the national and local capacities to a quicker transition in achieving more sustainable outcomes for children and women in the 14 highly affected Earthquake districts with a focus on building resilience, strengthening systems, capacity building and increasing local and national ownership.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: PAC: Information on UNICEF response to Nepal earthquake emergency is shared widely through media statements, news notes, pressmeet and releases, situation reports, multimedia content and social media feeds

description.narrative: UNICEF continued to highlight the impact of UNICEF's response in the earthquake-affected districts in Nepal through the production of multimedia materials and hosting high-profile donor visits. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2017

title.narrative: Information on UNICEF response to Nepal earthquake emergency is shared widely through media statements/ news notes, press releases / situation reports and social media feeds.

target.value: 2015:Weekly/fortnightly press releases/ news notes / situation reports

actual.value: 2015:On-track. 17 press releases issued, 23 Situation Reports produced, more than 50 human interest stories produced. 55 per cent increase in the number of likes on UNICEF Nepal Facebook page since 25 April 2015. Last year, the increase was 42 per cent of the same time period. 176 per cent increase in th

title.narrative: Increased visibility of humanitarian needs of survivors of earthquake through multimedia reportage

actual.value: 2017:A total of 59 communication materials - write-ups, video b-roll, video packages, and social media feeds produced

title.narrative: Increased support for UNICEF's work impacting the lives of earthquake-affected population by donors and NatComs

actual.value: 2017:In 2017 UNICEF hosted five visits; No new pledges for earthquake relief and response as well as for broader resilience proposal.

title.narrative: Increased coverage of issues of earthquake-impacted as well as UNICEF work in local and international media

actual.value: 2017:Publication of 12 multimedia news stories including additional ones in UK and Finnish media.
